transcript:
I am sitting in my small apartment, surrounded by the familiar comforts of home. The lights are slightly too bright, casting an unforgiving glow over everything, but it is a comfort I can tolerate. Today was the day I received the email - the internship offer. I hope that makes sense. I still feel a bit stunned. Phillip Jackson's words echoed in my mind: "You've done an exceptional job on your portfolio." Exceptional? It feels like he's selling me short. Still, it is something.

I keep thinking about what Curtis would say if she were here. Would she be proud of me? Or would she worry that I'm not ready? I try to push those thoughts away. David seems more focused on the practicalities - the hours, the pay, the benefits. He's right, of course. This is a chance to prove myself, to earn my place.

I've been thinking about self-worth a lot lately. Is it tied to this internship? Can I find value in other areas of my life if this one doesn't work out? I'm not sure if I'm overthinking again. Christopher would probably tell me to take a deep breath and focus on the present moment. Maybe he's right. I need to remind myself that one small accomplishment does not define me.

I'm feeling a sense of relief wash over me now - loyalty. The feeling is almost overwhelming, like it's going to consume me whole. I hope that makes sense. I just want to prove to myself that I'm capable of more than I thought.
